required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Assessment of T4020 Versus Vehicule in Patients With Chronic Neurotrophic Keratitis or Corneal Ulcer
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety Assessment of T4020 Versus Vehicule in Patients With Chronic Neurotrophic Keratitis or Corneal Ulcer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of T4020 versus vehicle.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Reduction in Neurotrophic the Keratitis/Ulcer Area on Day28
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in neurotrophic ulcer/keratitis area of 50% or more

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With at Least One Treatment-emergent Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first visit to the final visit performed by the patient + 1 month later, assessed up to 71 days

secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in far best-corrected visual acuity (LogMAR) in the pathologic eye

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients diagnosed with one chronic keratitis/corneal ulcer
- Patients who signed and dated informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient under 18 years
- Patient with a perforated corneal ulcer OR any risk of immediate perforation of corneal ulcer.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With a Reduction in Neurotrophic the Keratitis/Ulcer Area on Day28
outcome.description: Reduction in neurotrophic ulcer/keratitis area of 50% or more
outcome.population: Modified Intent to treat (m-ITT): All randomised patients received at least 1 IMP dose, with at least 1 baseline and 1 post-baseline efficacy assessment. For the primary outcome measure, 4 patients (2 in the T4020 and Vehicle groups) had no data for the reduction from baseline of corneal ulcer/keratitis area and were not included in this analysis

measure.title: Number of Participants With a Reduction in Neurotrophic the Keratitis/Ulcer Area on Day28
measure.description: Reduction in neurotrophic ulcer/keratitis area of 50% or more
measure.population: Modified Intent to treat (m-ITT): All randomised patients received at least 1 IMP dose, with at least 1 baseline and 1 post-baseline efficacy assessment. For the primary outcome measure, 4 patients (2 in the T4020 and Vehicle groups) had no data for the reduction from baseline of corneal ulcer/keratitis area and were not included in this analysis
